N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8501.4 - Fiscal officer

State Regulations
(a) The
fiscal officer shall certify the payroll and respond to requests for an
itemized record setting forth the name, address, title and salary of every
officer or employee of the agency. (b) The fiscal officer shall be the custodian
of the payroll record of the office. Any bona fide member of the news media
wishing to inspect and/or obtain a copy of such payroll record may make
application to the fiscal officer in writing on forms prescribed by the

Comptroller. Application to inspect and/or obtain a copy of such payroll record
shall be made to the fiscal officer by the member personally on any business
day during regular business hours at the office of the fiscal officer. Upon
receipt of such an application, in the proper form and at the appropriate time, and upon production by such member of appropriate identification, the fiscal
officer shall search for and produce for inspection the payroll record. If the
member requests a copy of such payroll record, the fiscal officer shall provide
him with one. The payroll record shall be available to persons other than bona
fide members of the news media to the extent required by law. Notes
